item.description:
I want to inform you of a fabulous benefit concert on May 7th. It features a very young and talented violinist, Aishu Venkataraman. Aishu is a brilliant musician and a gifted student has acquired a passion for the violin that transcends boundaries from the western hemisphere all the way to the far east. Aishu is the youngest graduate from the Berklee College of Music. Blending technique with melody Aishu keeps sharing with the world her talent, her poise and grace far beyond her years.

The concert is a fundraiser for International Campaign for Justice in Bhopal:
In 1984, the Indian city of Bhopal witnessed the world's worst industrial disaster with leakage of lethal Methyl Isocyanate gas from the Union Carbide factory (current owner- Dow
Chemicals). The Disaster is still happening with toxic contamination of the ground water because of the refusal by Dow to clean up the factory's dump site.

The International Camapaign for Justice in Bhopal ( ICJB) is a non-profit organization supporting the Bhopal Gas Disaster's survivors and victims.

Please help the ICJB. The Bhopal disaster has already needlessly claimed more than 25,000 lives. Let's put an end to it. Please help us.

 

More information on Aishu and Bhopal concert:
www.boston4bhopal.org

Tickets can be bought at:
https://www.brownpapertickets.com/event/169028
item.how_to_find_us: Cohen Auditorium Aidekman Arts Center, Tufts University
item.name: Violin Concert - Fundraising for "International Campaign for Justice in Bhopal"
